file_content.text: I was hoping to find you alive. Quite a narrow escape.
Darth Tormen was not as fortunate, I trust?
He won't bother anyone again.
I took care of him, personally.
He went down with the ship.
The only thing he escaped was a costly burial.
Not even a little.
Good... good, at least it's done.
You're doubting I held up my end of the bargain?
What are you implying?
Not at all. I only wanted confirmation that he won't trouble anyone again.
Perhaps it's best that I'm getting out of politics. Arranging assassinations couldn't be farther from what I've stood for.
After falling this far, I suppose there's no point in trying to recover my principles. Coming clean would only do more harm than good.
Principles are important.
You don't cast off honor when it's inconvenient.
I never said I was excusing my failures, only living with them. It was for a greater good.
We may be far from achieving peaceful coexistence, but the fewer men like Tormen that come to power, the better our chances.
You've already sacrificed your career for the sake of honesty. Why stop now?
I don't see the harm in it.
Who benefits? My conscience, maybe, but who else? Certainly not you.
As far as anyone knows, Tormen died in a foolish naval battle. Let's leave it that way.
I prefer keeping the Empire in the dark about our little arrangement.
Good point.
I thought you might.
You're a good man, Chancellor. The Republic will be worse off without you.
I appreciate what you're doing.
I'm glad you weren't the monster Jun made you out to be.
Then I'm done hearing about problems you aren't going to fix. Get to the ones you are.
Fine, but quit your crying.
Speaking of coming clean. How's my record looking?
Uh-huh, what about my pardon?
You'll be exonerated as I promised. Even if my replacement questions the justification, overturning it would be more trouble than it's worth.
I'm also sending a small reimbursement for your lost wages. It isn't much, but there are more important things than pride and wealth.
I hope you'll continue to use such good judgment in the future.
I killed Tormen because you made the better offer.
I do the job that pays.
Bounty hunting is a job. I get paid, you get results. Pass that advice on to your replacement.
I'm a Mandalorian, Chancellor. We may not follow your rules, but we've got our priorities straight.
I will do as honor demands.
You may not know how to handle a blaster, but you're prepared to die for what you believe in. That's good enough for me.
Live in honor, Chancellor. Wherever you end up.
I'm not a fan of the law, Chancellor, but I know the difference between right and wrong.
I'm a good person.
Funny thing about this business: Most of the work comes from bad apples, and they're usually the ones who wind up visited by people like me.
Consider it me doing my civic duty.
I didn't need to finish the job to know I had you dead to rights.
I hunt the biggest challenge.
You're alive because killing a Dark Lord of the Sith was too good an opportunity to resist.
Retire someplace quiet. Next time, you might not be so lucky. Now if you'll excuse me, bigger challenges await.
Don't mistake my help for generosity.
I serve nobody.
Tormen thought he could use me. It was time to show him otherwise.
Remember that, before you or yours try to pull something cute. Nobody ever gets to tell me where to go or what to do.
So many people willing to lay down their lives for me. It should have never come to this.
There's something I want to tell you... before you do what you came to do.
Don't beg, Chancellor. It's unbecoming.
We have nothing to discuss.
Just... bear with me. Consider it a last request, if that means anything.
It's not everyday I get to chat with the leader of the free galaxy.
I don't see the harm in it.
I'd ask you to sit, but I prefer not to kid myself.
You better have one hell of an apology lined up.
"Sorry" isn't going to cut it.
You deserve more of an apology than I'm capable of giving.
I reviewed the reports surrounding the operation to apprehend you. It's... atrocious. A monumental abuse of power.
I don't condone what you were doing, but I understand it. It was just your job. Jun made it personal.
It would have come to this eventually. You're good business.
You don't need to blame Jun.
Maybe before, but now I wouldn't be so sure. I've declassified the details of Jun Seros's actions against you.
Soon the Senate and the people will know that elements of my administration doctored official records to further a personal agenda.
Jun paid his debt to me in blood; I hope you won't make the same mistake.
You willing to be reasonable?
That's exactly what I wanted to speak with you about.
You expect me to believe you had nothing to do with this? I watched you condemn me--live--on the HoloNet.
Don't plead ignorance.
I authorized the operation to bring you to justice, but what Jun did was beyond his authority.
I've already declassified the real details of yours and Jun's actions to the public.
The fallout will be tremendous. No matter how our meeting concludes, I'll be removed from office.
Hoping to get fired before I can claim my bounty?
You think that'll save you?
This isn't about me. It's about the truth. A Republic cannot be based on deception, especially on matters of war.
I'm sure it wasn't easy to come clean knowing your career would be sunk.
That was big of you.
Jun had no right to deceive the public and neither do I. The people must be able to believe their leaders.
Tarnishing your reputation doesn't get mine any cleaner.
That's a small consolation.
In this case, you're wrong.
The false accusations will disappear as the truth is separated from the lies. It's not a clean slate, but it's what you deserve.
I'm willing to take things a step further, if you're willing to work with me.
Give me a reason to believe anything you've said.
Prove you aren't bluffing.
The reports are right here. Take a look for yourself. Keep them. Whatever will allay your suspicion.
My offer is immunity for your past crimes, the real ones--if you're willing to show me you're not firmly in the Empire's pocket.
One good turn deserves another. What are you offering?
All right, I'll bite.
Immunity--if you're willing to show me you're not firmly in the Empire's pocket.
Jun believed you were in league with a Sith named Tormen. Is that true?
Tormen sent me to collect your head.
He's my employer.
I feared as much. He's using us to make his mark.
We have a partnership of convenience, that's all.
We aren't close.
It's a partnership you should end.
I really couldn't say.
That's answer enough. Be careful who you put your confidence in.
Tormen's a monster. His troops have been butchering Corellians. On Rabaan, he flattened kilometers of homes, businesses, hospitals.
A man like that can't be given more power. Let's fix this while we're in a position to do so.
Blizz help fix scary droid-man if boss want.
This discussion is over.
No deal.
You want to fix something? Start here.
Don't listen to the dead man.
Keep your word and we'll pull Tormen's plug.
You've got a deal, Chancellor.
Glad you cleared that up for us. I'd have never suspected a Lord of the Sith to be so cruel!
Come on, you've seen what that mechanized terror is capable of. Let's stay on what passes for his good side.
I bet we could come to some agreement, Chancellor. If I were in a talking mood.
Relax, his offer is a joke.
That monster's had me under his thumb long enough.
I'm taking this deal.
You're gonna be under his boot if you aren't careful.
I say we do 'em both.
Tormen plays straight and pays well. There's no question whose side I'm on.
I don't cross a good employer.
Cute, but short-sighted. We'll deal with Tormen when he starts getting stingy.
No, just this one.
Tempting, but I like getting paid. We'll deal with Tormen when he starts getting stingy.
No, just this one.
Just because you like being called a murderer, that doesn't make it a compliment.
I'm taking this offer.
The Chancellor wants to make a liar out of you.
I wanted to hear him out, nothing more.
I haven't changed my mind.
He could throw offers at me until the treasury ran dry.
You think I'd let him go now?
I'd rather be a liar than whatever Tormen wants me to be.
No more being the bad guy.
Well... we haven't had much choice about working with Tormen until now. This could be our out.
Finishing the job is our out.
I don't go back on a contract.
Who needs a pardon when you're the most feared killer in the galaxy?
I don't want a clean slate.
Tormen's had us under his thumb for too long.
I think you're right, Mako.
Kill Tormen, you're the only one who can.
No deal. [Freeze him]
I agreed to this hunt. I keep my word.
I'll have to decline, Chancellor.
Boss usually freeze people when job done. This mean boss and Blizz job done?
Bet that's not the monument he was hoping for.
Ever try smashin' one of these?
Quite a catch.
This had better be the last job we do for Darth Creepy.
I've got the Supreme Chancellor in custody.
Tormen's a nobody.
And miss this? [Kill him]
Today, I'd rather make history.
Chancellor, you just made my day.
It'd be my pleasure.
Keep your word and Tormen will disappear.
I'd be glad to.
Um... Blizz just wait until boss say what boss need Blizz to fix.
Gonna chicken outta killin' him, too?
Dark lord's good sport, at least.
At least we can agree on that.
It's time to show him who's boss.
I understand the risk you're taking. Thank you.
The Supreme Chancellor's been dealt with.
Thanks for clearing up my record. You really shouldn't have.
I'm not. [Kill the Chancellor]
Blizz think boss not like many people. Blizz hope boss like Blizz....
Eek! Why boss blast old man in chair?
Least he went out with a bang. What?
Didn't even get a proper scream outta 'im.
One for the records.
The Republic's never going to stop hounding us now.
I've got your head, Tormen.
Good. Make for the Tyrant. The fleet will cover your escape.
We'll engage the Imperial fleet, but I'll have to survive this to hold up my end of the bargain.
If you can somehow cripple the Tyrant after dealing with Tormen, we can handle the rest.
The Tyrant won't trouble you, Chancellor.
I've got it covered.
I'll bet they've barely patched the damage from the last time.
Shouldn't be hard to sabotage.
If I never see that ship again, it'll be too soon.
I won't miss it.
